P.title: Will gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes be detected by November 30, 2027?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as positive if by November 30, 2027, a peer-reviewed publication announces the results of such an event. Statistical significance should be at the 4-sigma or equivalent level.
*(edit 1/1017) November 30 is now a publication date rather than data cutoff date.

Q_given_P.title: Given that gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes will be detected by November 30, 2027, will a practical nuclear fusion reactor first be developed in China?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if the detection of gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes is not announced by November 30, 2027. If the condition is met (if the detection is announced by Nov 30, 2027), then resolves as per the criteria for the development of a practical nuclear fusion reactor in China.

P_and_Q.title: Will gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes be detected by November 30, 2027 AND will a practical nuclear fusion reactor first be developed in China?
P_and_Q.body: Resolves YES if by November 30, 2027, a peer-reviewed publication announces the results of the detection of gravitational waves from the merger of supermassive black holes AND the first practical nuclear fusion reactor meeting the specified criteria is developed in China. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will any of Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, and/or Germany leave the EU before 2027?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2027, one or more of Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, and/or Germany triggers Article 50 of the Treaty of Lisbon by notifying the European Council of its intention to leave the union.
It also resolves as positive if by the same deadline the entity called European Union has dissolved completely or dissolved to create a new politico-economic union of some European nations under a different name

Q_given_P.title: Given that before 2027, any of Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, and/or Germany leave the EU, will the European Union meet its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if none of the mentioned countries leave the EU before 2027. If any of the mentioned countries trigger Article 50 or the EU dissolves before 2027, then resolves YES if the EU meets its 2030 climate targets as per the Paris Climate Treaty, and NO if it doesn't meet the targets by January 1, 2030.

P_and_Q.title: Will any of Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, and/or Germany leave the EU before 2027 AND will the European Union meet its 2030 targets under the Paris Climate Treaty?
P_and_Q.body: Resolves YES if before January 1, 2027, one or more of Belgium, France, Italy, Luxembourg, Netherlands, and/or Germany triggers Article 50 of the Treaty of Lisbon by notifying the European Council of its intention to leave the union OR if the European Union has dissolved completely or dissolved to create a new politico-economic union of some European nations under a different name AND a credible news report cites an analysis independent of the European Union government confirming that Europe has met all three 2030 climate action goals, including emission reduction by at least 40% below 1990 levels, on or before January 1, 2030. Resolves NO otherwise.

P.title: Will China reduce their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve as Yes China meets its primary 2030 climate action goals of cutting emissions intensity by at least 60% below 2005 levels on or before January 1, 2030, according to expert analysis independent of the Chinese government

Q_given_P.title: Given that China reduces their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030, will any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035?
Q_given_P.body: Resolves N/A if China does not reduce their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030. If the condition is met (if China reduces emissions by 60% by 2030), then resolves YES if any of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035 according to the specified criteria, and NO if none of them do by 2035.

P_and_Q.title: Will China reduce their carbon emissions per GDP by 60% by 2030 AND will any country that had nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 give them up before 2035?
P_and_Q.body: Resolves YES if China meets its primary 2030 climate action goals of cutting emissions intensity by at least 60% below 2005 levels on or before January 1, 2030, according to expert analysis independent of the Chinese government AND if one of the 9 nations known to possess nuclear weapons on July 1, 2017 is certified by the International Atomic Energy Agency to have dismantled all nuclear devices and signs the 2017 UN ban on nuclear weapons on or before January 1, 2035. Resolves NO otherwise.
